definition: the Qing Dynasty name for the coastal provinces of Liaoning, Hebei, and Shandong
north/(classical) to be defeated
ocean/vast/foreign/silver dollar or coin
the Northern Warlords (1912-1927)
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
north China navy (esp. the ill-fated Chinese navy in the 1895 war with Japan)
Beiyang faction of Northern Warlords
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
north China army (esp. during the warlords period)

sentences.english: The period of the Northern Warlords' rule over China was an era of a great change.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀统治时期，是个大变局时代。

sentences.english: Beiyang government and Manjing government are corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀政府及南京国民政府政治腐败。

sentences.english: The period of BeiYang government, the traditional legal system starts modern reforming.
sentences.chinese: 北洋政府时期，传统法制开始近代转型。

sentences.english: The government called out troops and policemen to suppress the demonstators and over thirty students were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀政府出动军警镇压，捕去学生三十多名。

sentences.english: Postwar, Hannekon was promoted to General and made consultant to the Beiyang Navy.
sentences.chinese: 战后清廷授升其为将军兼北洋海军总部顾问。

sentences.english: The Northern Warlord government called out troops and policemen to suppress the demonstration and over thirty students were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀政府出动军警镇压，捕去学生三十多名。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 elaborates ethnic policies under the reign of the Northern Warlords Government.
sentences.chinese: 第四章为北洋军阀政府的民族政策。

sentences.english: He is very interested in the history of the Beiyang Warlords.
sentences.chinese: 他对北洋军阀的那段历史很感兴趣。

sentences.english: Naval port in northern China, the Qing northern naval base.
sentences.chinese: 中国北方军港，清朝北洋水师基地。

sentences.english: Northern Warlords are a special military and political force in modern China.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀是中国近代一支特殊的军事政治力量。

sentences.english: Beiyang Fleet's fees was overrun 2600, 0000 tael at the same stage.
sentences.chinese: 北洋海军此时期的经费，逾2600万两。

sentences.english: Beiyang Navy is the earliest naval force of China.
sentences.chinese: 北洋水师是中国最早的海军部队。

sentences.english: In the reign of the Northern Warlords, with the frequent wars, education was stagnant.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀统治时期，战祸不断，殃及教育。

sentences.english: Beiyang Group played a certain role in the early modernization of China by means of promoting decision-making of modernization of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 北洋集团在中国早期现代化运动中起到了一定的作用。

sentences.english: During the period of Beiyang Government, Bank of China was the biggest bank invested by the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 北洋政府时期，中国很行是华资银行中最大的银行。

sentences.english: The government intensified its suppression and arrested over 170 students.
sentences.chinese: 北洋政府加紧镇压并再次逮捕170多名学生。

definition: north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
the Northern Warlords (1912-1927)
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
north China navy (esp. the ill-fated Chinese navy in the 1895 war with Japan)
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Beiyang faction of Northern Warlords
Qing government (1644-1911)
Great Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Fengtian clique (of northern warlords)
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
Ni Sichong (1868-1924), general closely linked to Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 during his unsuccessful 1915 bid for Empire
Fengtian clique (of northern warlords)
Xu Shichang (1855-1939), politician associated with the Northern Warlords, president of China in 1921
